com.github.cooperroalson.untitled_thinggy_thingg.core

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.cooperroalson.untitled_thinggy_thingg.core.GameManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The class that manages the entire game. It stores instances of important classes like WindowManager and MapState, and keeps track of the current GameState. It basically holds everything together. There is one static instace of it, which is accessible to everything through the getInstance() method. It implements Runnable, so it can be started in a new Thread using Thread.Thread(Runnable) and Thread.start().

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameManager()
      Creates a new GameManager, along with a WindowManager, an EventHandler, and a MapState.

      • getInstance

        public static GameManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        The static instance of GameManager accessible to everything.

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the gameloop. This is typically activated via a Thread, using Thread.Thread(Runnable) and Thread.start(). It first runs init().
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • createOrAddUI

        public void createOrAddUI(UIComponent c,
                          int x,
                          int y,
                          UIGameState.UIPauseMode pauseMode)
        Adds a UIComponent to the current gamestate, creating a new UIGameState if necessary.
        Parameters:
        c - The component to add
        x - The x coordinate of the component's top-left corner
        y - The y coordinate of the component's top-left corner
        pauseMode - The UIPauseMode to use in the UIGameState

      • removeUI

        public boolean removeUI(UIComponent c)
        Removes a UIComponent from the current gamestate, deleting the UIGameState if it becomes empty. Returns true if the component was found and deleted, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        c - The component to remove
        Returns:
        Whether the removal suceeded

        See Also:

      • addActionMap

        public void addActionMap(javax.swing.ActionMap map)
        Appends to the current JPanel's ActionMap. This registers new KeyActions.
        Parameters:
        map - The action map to append
        See Also:
        JComponent.setActionMap(ActionMap), ActionMap.setParent(ActionMap), setGameState(GameState), GameState.registerActionMap()

      • setGameState

        public void setGameState(GameState gs)
        Changes to a new GameState. This calls the GameState.registerKeyBindings(JComponent) and GameState.registerActionMap() methods of the new GameState.
        Parameters:
        gs - The new GameState
        See Also:
        setInputMap(ComponentInputMap), addActionMap(ActionMap)
